description: The VMware Certified Professional certification is the most highly recognized certification dealing specifically with virtualization technologies. VMware vSphere is the leading virtualization technology available today and is in use at most large organizations. The VMware Certified Professional â€“ Data Center Virtualization (VCP5-DCV) certification is tailored towards IT System Administrators who are looking to deploy and maintain VMware vSphere and its associated products (ESXi, VDP, vCOP, VMware Converter, etc) in their environment.
name: VMware Certified Professional 5 VCP5-DCV
subtitle: Data Center Virtualization

episodes.description: The VMware Certified Professional certification is the most highly recognized certification dealing specifically with virtualization technologies. VMware vSphere is the leading virtualization technology available today and is in use at most large organizations. The VMware Certified Professional - Data Center Virtualization (VCP5-DCV) certification is tailored towards IT System Administrators who are looking to deploy and maintain VMware vSphere and its associated products (ESXi, VDP, vCOP, VMware Converter, etc) in their environment.
episodes.title: Overview of VMware VCP5-DCV
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:00,617 --> 00:00:07,505
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:07,505 --> 00:00:12,930
Let's take a minute to look at the VMware
Certified Professional certification.

3
00:00:12,930 --> 00:00:16,600
The VCP is one of the most well
known virtualization certifications

4
00:00:16,600 --> 00:00:18,230
in the IT industry.

5
00:00:18,230 --> 00:00:21,700
As a result, when somebody says they're
gonna go and get a certification

6
00:00:21,700 --> 00:00:25,100
that relates to virtualization,
this is normally the one that they go for.

7
00:00:25,100 --> 00:00:28,110
It is a little more complex and
a little bit different than the other

8
00:00:28,110 --> 00:00:32,650
certifications you might be used to, so I
wanna make sure we talk about what it is,

9
00:00:32,650 --> 00:00:37,790
who it's targeted towards, and some of
the little caveats that go along with it.

10
00:00:37,790 --> 00:00:40,130
First off,
if you're not familiar with VMware,

11
00:00:40,130 --> 00:00:44,800
VMware is a company that is the market
leader in virtualization technologies.

12
00:00:44,800 --> 00:00:47,760
If you go to work for any medium, large,

13
00:00:47,760 --> 00:00:52,650
or enterprise-sized organization, you
will find VMware virtualization products.

14
00:00:52,650 --> 00:00:55,280
They outnumber Microsoft Hyper-V and

15
00:00:55,280 --> 00:00:58,030
Citrix XenServer by just
astronomical amounts.

16
00:00:58,030 --> 00:01:02,220
They have a huge portion of the market
share, and there's a good reason for it.

17
00:01:02,220 --> 00:01:04,870
Their virtualization
products are top-notch.

18
00:01:04,870 --> 00:01:07,290
So if you find yourself
working in that market,

19
00:01:07,290 --> 00:01:10,440
the VCP certification becomes
very attractive to you.

20
00:01:10,440 --> 00:01:13,870
It's a way to say that you
know how to implement and

21
00:01:13,870 --> 00:01:16,790
maintain VMware technologies and
do it successfully.

22
00:01:16,790 --> 00:01:20,780
So it is a hot topic,
definitely a good entry on your resume,

23
00:01:20,780 --> 00:01:21,610
if that's what you're looking for.

24
00:01:22,860 --> 00:01:27,560
However, the VCP is targeted a little
differently than a lot of certifications.

25
00:01:27,560 --> 00:01:31,480
VCP is not designed for
somebody just getting started in IT,

26
00:01:31,480 --> 00:01:36,510
or somebody who's just transitioning
their career over or something like that.

27
00:01:36,510 --> 00:01:40,760
VCP is designed for
people who are already entrenched in IT.

28
00:01:40,760 --> 00:01:43,680
People who have already been working
with servers and workstations,

29
00:01:43,680 --> 00:01:47,780
and are entering and already working
in the virtualization market.

30
00:01:47,780 --> 00:01:53,310
We wanna show that you know the high level
knowledge, the really important stuff,

31
00:01:53,310 --> 00:01:56,520
as far as deploying this technology and
deploying it correctly.

32
00:01:58,390 --> 00:02:01,250
First off, one thing we need to
know about the VCP is that there's

33
00:02:01,250 --> 00:02:02,590
more than one of them, all right?

34
00:02:02,590 --> 00:02:06,220
It used to be there was only a single VCP,
the VMware Certified Professional.

35
00:02:06,220 --> 00:02:07,610
But as the company grew and

36
00:02:07,610 --> 00:02:10,300
they added more products,
they started to branch it out.

37
00:02:10,300 --> 00:02:14,540
So when go to VMware's website, and you
go into their certification and training

38
00:02:14,540 --> 00:02:20,140
section, you'll find where the VCP is
actually broken down into several chunks.

39
00:02:20,140 --> 00:02:24,520
There's the VCP Data Center
Virtualization, or DCV.

40
00:02:24,520 --> 00:02:27,050
There's Cloud, End User Computing,

41
00:02:27,050 --> 00:02:31,150
Network Virtualization, and
Cloud Application Platform.

42
00:02:31,150 --> 00:02:36,160
These are all different types of VCP,
and you'll see them kind of

43
00:02:36,160 --> 00:02:40,390
written over here where
you've got VCP5-DCV.

44
00:02:40,390 --> 00:02:42,490
That's the most common one right there.

45
00:02:42,490 --> 00:02:46,240
That's the VMware Certified Professional
version five,

46
00:02:46,240 --> 00:02:48,370
DCV is Data Center Virtualization.

47
00:02:48,370 --> 00:02:53,160
So when most people say, yeah, I'm a VCP,
that's the one they're talking about.

48
00:02:53,160 --> 00:02:58,030
But you could also be VCP Cloud or
Network Virtualization, or whatever.

49
00:02:58,030 --> 00:03:01,070
You could be one of these
other certifications based on

50
00:03:01,070 --> 00:03:04,510
what it is that you chose to do,
what certification path you followed.

51
00:03:04,510 --> 00:03:09,553
So you can see VCP Cloud,
here's VCP5-DT, and login.

52
00:03:09,553 --> 00:03:12,988
These are all variations of that
VMWare Certified Professional.

53
00:03:12,988 --> 00:03:17,346
But the most common one, that's
the one that we're gonna be recording

54
00:03:17,346 --> 00:03:22,286
here at ITProTV, and that's the VMware
Certified Professional version five,

55
00:03:22,286 --> 00:03:24,480
for a data center virtualization.

56
00:03:25,610 --> 00:03:32,070
Now with VCP version five, what VMware
did is they did something interesting,

57
00:03:32,070 --> 00:03:35,670
and it makes this a little more
challenging than the other certifications.

58
00:03:35,670 --> 00:03:40,250
Most of the time with ITProTV, you can
come here and you can watch our shows,

59
00:03:40,250 --> 00:03:44,940
you can learn everything that you need to
know, you can go and take the exam, and

60
00:03:44,940 --> 00:03:47,010
you can get certified, all right?

61
00:03:47,010 --> 00:03:49,230
This is going to be an exception.

62
00:03:49,230 --> 00:03:53,620
Watching our show is not enough to be
able to get the VCP certification.

63
00:03:53,620 --> 00:03:56,370
We're gonna cover all the topics,
we'll cover all the information and

64
00:03:56,370 --> 00:03:58,480
have you prepared to take that exam.

65
00:03:58,480 --> 00:04:01,600
But in order to take the exam,

66
00:04:01,600 --> 00:04:07,090
VMware requires that you attend
their official certification course.

67
00:04:07,090 --> 00:04:11,040
So the only people allowed to
take the exams are ones who

68
00:04:11,040 --> 00:04:15,560
have taken the course from VMware,
from the actual company.

69
00:04:15,560 --> 00:04:19,940
So you might ask yourself,
why are we even recording this at ITProTV?

70
00:04:19,940 --> 00:04:25,320
And the reason is not everyone is
looking to get that certification.

71
00:04:25,320 --> 00:04:28,030
Maybe you're looking to get
the requisite knowledge.

72
00:04:28,030 --> 00:04:29,920
VMware is very common.

73
00:04:29,920 --> 00:04:33,090
It is very widely deployed
out there in the real world.

74
00:04:33,090 --> 00:04:34,480
So maybe you wanna learn that.

75
00:04:34,480 --> 00:04:39,250
But the official VMware course,
it costs over $4,000, it's a lot of money.

76
00:04:39,250 --> 00:04:42,880
So maybe you wanna get the knowledge
without incurring that huge hit to your

77
00:04:42,880 --> 00:04:45,770
pocketbook, or
getting the certification isn't your goal.

78
00:04:45,770 --> 00:04:47,050
Or maybe it is.

79
00:04:47,050 --> 00:04:51,150
Maybe you already took the official VMware
course, but it's been a little while since

80
00:04:51,150 --> 00:04:55,120
you took it and the information's getting
a little rusty, and you want a refresher.

81
00:04:55,120 --> 00:04:59,000
Whatever your case is,
the ITProTV solution is a great one.

82
00:04:59,000 --> 00:05:03,950
So just bear in mind, if you want to get
the certification, if you want to go and

83
00:05:03,950 --> 00:05:05,930
get those letters to put on your resume,

84
00:05:05,930 --> 00:05:09,170
you will have to take
the official course from VMware.

85
00:05:09,170 --> 00:05:11,890
There's no way around that,
you've got to do it.

86
00:05:12,900 --> 00:05:18,230
Otherwise, our course, our VCP little
track that we're gonna do here on ITProTV,

87
00:05:18,230 --> 00:05:19,930
it covers all the same content.

88
00:05:19,930 --> 00:05:21,290
We cover every bit of it.

89
00:05:21,290 --> 00:05:23,550
We go through and we make sure
that you've got that knowledge.

90
00:05:23,550 --> 00:05:26,732
It's also a great supplement to
people who have taken the course.

91
00:05:26,732 --> 00:05:30,450
All right, so when you go on to
the certification site for VMware, and

92
00:05:30,450 --> 00:05:34,721
you go into that VCP5-DCV page,
when you go into there,

93
00:05:34,721 --> 00:05:37,980
it's gonna explain a few things to you.

94
00:05:37,980 --> 00:05:39,880
First off,
it's got the exam blueprint, and

95
00:05:39,880 --> 00:05:42,600
that's a great to thing to download
because it's gonna tell you about

96
00:05:42,600 --> 00:05:46,190
all the objectives that are on the exam,
what the exam covers.

97
00:05:46,190 --> 00:05:48,900
And it covers a lot of stuff.

98
00:05:48,900 --> 00:05:51,220
But before you even dive in there,
you have to make a choice.

99
00:05:51,220 --> 00:05:54,260
There's actually two exams,
they should both be here.

100
00:05:56,300 --> 00:05:58,140
Well, they mention it here, but

101
00:05:58,140 --> 00:06:00,900
they don't actually mention it
as far as the exam numbers.

102
00:06:00,900 --> 00:06:02,300
But there are two exams.

103
00:06:02,300 --> 00:06:09,810
There's the VCP550,
is the official exam number, VCP550.

104
00:06:09,810 --> 00:06:13,910
And another one that is the VCP510.

105
00:06:13,910 --> 00:06:18,210
One exam is for the older vSphere 5,
and then the other exams is for

106
00:06:18,210 --> 00:06:20,445
the newer vSphere 5.5.

107
00:06:20,445 --> 00:06:24,752
So for the ITProTV show,
we're covering the vSphere 5.5.

108
00:06:24,752 --> 00:06:29,699
There's not a ton of difference between
the two, and there are some new features,

109
00:06:29,699 --> 00:06:33,910
things that were added in 5.5
that weren't there in 5.1.

110
00:06:33,910 --> 00:06:37,070
But as far as the base functionality,
they're very much the same,

111
00:06:37,070 --> 00:06:38,240
very similar products.

112
00:06:38,240 --> 00:06:40,350
So we're just gonna go with the newest,

113
00:06:40,350 --> 00:06:43,700
because why cover the old
stuff when new stuff is out?

114
00:06:43,700 --> 00:06:44,980
So we're gonna be doing vSphere 5.5.

115
00:06:44,980 --> 00:06:48,624
So when you sign up for the exam,
if you've taken the official course,

116
00:06:48,624 --> 00:06:53,210
you know which one you need to do, whether
it's VCP510 or VCP550, based on that.

117
00:06:53,210 --> 00:06:58,891
But you'll notice right here, even right
here on this page if we scroll down,

118
00:06:58,891 --> 00:07:03,711
it's got what you need to do to
take the VCP510 or 550 exams,

119
00:07:03,711 --> 00:07:06,050
and it lists it right here.

120
00:07:06,050 --> 00:07:09,910
If you are just starting with
VMware Data Center Virtualization,

121
00:07:09,910 --> 00:07:12,950
training courses required, all right?

122
00:07:12,950 --> 00:07:17,340
You are required to take the VMware
vSphere Install, Configure, and

123
00:07:17,340 --> 00:07:20,960
Manage, or the Fast Track,
or Optimize and Scale.

124
00:07:20,960 --> 00:07:26,045
You can take any one of these courses
to qualify to take the actual exam.

125
00:07:26,045 --> 00:07:29,815
But if you haven't taken one of
these official courses from VMware,

126
00:07:29,815 --> 00:07:31,913
you're not allowed to register for
the exam.

127
00:07:31,913 --> 00:07:33,595
I can't emphasize that enough,

128
00:07:33,595 --> 00:07:36,340
I wanna make sure everybody's
expectations are set.

129
00:07:36,340 --> 00:07:40,910
However, maybe you took the VMware
vSphere Troubleshooting Workshop.

130
00:07:40,910 --> 00:07:44,170
If you did that one,
you can go and take the exam.

131
00:07:45,210 --> 00:07:48,000
But that means you didn't take Install,
Configure, and Manage, and

132
00:07:48,000 --> 00:07:50,312
that's what we're going to
be doing here in this show.

133
00:07:50,312 --> 00:07:52,990
And so that's another place
where ITProTV can come in.

134
00:07:52,990 --> 00:07:55,630
We can supplement that knowledge so
you don't have to go in and

135
00:07:55,630 --> 00:07:57,600
take multiple courses
if you don't need to.

136
00:07:59,090 --> 00:08:00,530
But there is no way around that.

137
00:08:00,530 --> 00:08:03,560
You've got to do the training course.

138
00:08:03,560 --> 00:08:05,284
Now there is one exception to that,
I suppose,

139
00:08:05,284 --> 00:08:07,430
I shouldn't say there's no way around it.

140
00:08:07,430 --> 00:08:12,130
If you already have your VCP
certification, when you get certified,

141
00:08:12,130 --> 00:08:15,000
you have to re-certify every two years.

142
00:08:15,000 --> 00:08:19,300
So once you've got the cert, you can't
just kick back and rest on your laurels.

143
00:08:19,300 --> 00:08:20,880
Every two years you've got to re-certify,

144
00:08:20,880 --> 00:08:25,620
and the way you re-certify
is by taking the exam again.

145
00:08:25,620 --> 00:08:28,370
Now you don't have to
take the course again,

146
00:08:28,370 --> 00:08:30,490
you just have to take the exam again.

147
00:08:30,490 --> 00:08:34,920
And so if you're re-certifying under 5.5,
well, our show will work great for you.

148
00:08:34,920 --> 00:08:36,280
You don't have to take the course again.

149
00:08:36,280 --> 00:08:38,370
You can watch our show,
go and take that exam.

150
00:08:39,960 --> 00:08:42,700
Well, let's talk a little
bit about the exam itself.

151
00:08:42,700 --> 00:08:47,050
On the exam certification page, you'll see
where you can download the blueprint, and

152
00:08:47,050 --> 00:08:47,790
the blueprint,

153
00:08:47,790 --> 00:08:52,610
it actually has a full exam guide that
tells you all about the examination.

154
00:08:52,610 --> 00:08:53,600
I've got it pulled up here.

155
00:08:54,630 --> 00:08:58,860
And it starts off by giving you some
basic general information about the exam,

156
00:08:58,860 --> 00:09:02,702
and then it jumps right
into the exam objectives.

157
00:09:02,702 --> 00:09:04,640
What's gonna be covered on the exam,

158
00:09:04,640 --> 00:09:07,770
what you can expect that test
question to be made up from.

159
00:09:08,860 --> 00:09:10,735
But the exam itself is really
pretty straightforward.

160
00:09:10,735 --> 00:09:13,210
It's a predominantly multiple choice exam.

161
00:09:13,210 --> 00:09:14,760
There are some pictorial and

162
00:09:14,760 --> 00:09:17,590
simulation questions, but for
the most part it's multiple choice.

163
00:09:17,590 --> 00:09:19,560
And it's made up of 135 questions.

164
00:09:21,130 --> 00:09:26,190
It's 135 questions, and
you get two hours, 120 minutes.

165
00:09:26,190 --> 00:09:30,350
So you need to be answering questions
quickly, less than a minute per question.

166
00:09:30,350 --> 00:09:33,360
So it's not an exam you want to
dally on if you can avoid it.

167
00:09:33,360 --> 00:09:36,680
You wanna answer those questions and
move forward, all right.

168
00:09:36,680 --> 00:09:39,410
It's graded on a scale from 100 to 500.

169
00:09:39,410 --> 00:09:41,198
The lowest score you can get is a 100.

170
00:09:41,198 --> 00:09:42,803
The highest score you can get is a 500.

171
00:09:42,803 --> 00:09:45,221
A 300 is passing.

172
00:09:45,221 --> 00:09:49,170
So you need to score at least
a 300 to get the certification.

173
00:09:50,570 --> 00:09:54,320
Now when you're in there taking that exam,
it's pretty straightforward.

174
00:09:54,320 --> 00:09:56,866
There is a short little survey at
the beginning, I think it's seven or

175
00:09:56,866 --> 00:09:57,958
eight questions you answer.

176
00:09:57,958 --> 00:10:01,433
And then it goes right into it,
and you answer your 135 questions.

177
00:10:01,433 --> 00:10:02,913
It's computer-scored,

178
00:10:02,913 --> 00:10:07,530
so you'll know right at the end of
exam whether you've passed or failed.

179
00:10:07,530 --> 00:10:11,310
The exam's administered by Pearson VUE,
so if you wanna take the exam,

180
00:10:11,310 --> 00:10:14,550
you actually go to Pearson VUE's
website to register for it.

181
00:10:14,550 --> 00:10:19,230
But before you can even register, if I go
back here, this is the VMware page again.

182
00:10:19,230 --> 00:10:22,710
And so I'm looking at
the certification benefits and

183
00:10:22,710 --> 00:10:26,100
other information here,
what you need to do to get certified.

184
00:10:26,100 --> 00:10:28,470
And then you've got down
here under Prepare for Exam,

185
00:10:28,470 --> 00:10:31,080
you've got the exam blueprint,
study guide, and practice.

186
00:10:31,080 --> 00:10:32,620
So, you've got various things.

187
00:10:32,620 --> 00:10:36,830
When you get down here to exam
registration though, if we go to register,

188
00:10:36,830 --> 00:10:39,570
you'll see it'll tell you about
the two exams, VCP550 and VCP510,

189
00:10:39,570 --> 00:10:43,590
and you've got Download
the Exam Blueprint,

190
00:10:43,590 --> 00:10:47,910
that's what I was looking at a moment ago,
and request authorization.

191
00:10:47,910 --> 00:10:49,210
That's that key piece.

192
00:10:49,210 --> 00:10:51,670
You can't just go to Pearson VUE and
take the exam.

193
00:10:51,670 --> 00:10:53,590
You've got to, oh, I'm not logged in.

194
00:10:53,590 --> 00:10:56,510
You've got to request authorization first.

195
00:10:56,510 --> 00:11:00,420
And basically what you're doing is you're
saying hey, I took the official course,

196
00:11:00,420 --> 00:11:04,560
here's my registration information,
can I please sign up with Pearson?

197
00:11:04,560 --> 00:11:09,040
And they'll give you a code, and you call
up Pearson or you go to their website,

198
00:11:09,040 --> 00:11:11,360
and you'll present that code to
be able to register for the exam.

199
00:11:11,360 --> 00:11:12,190
Exam.
All right, so

200
00:11:12,190 --> 00:11:15,380
that's a key,
important part of the process there.

201
00:11:16,450 --> 00:11:19,530
And don't think poorly of VMware
because they have this restriction.

202
00:11:19,530 --> 00:11:20,710
They do it for a reason.

203
00:11:20,710 --> 00:11:25,380
They want to ensure that everyone who
takes that exam has the same experience,

204
00:11:25,380 --> 00:11:27,210
the same training before they go in.

205
00:11:27,210 --> 00:11:30,070
And they wanna be very tightly
controlled in that training.

206
00:11:30,070 --> 00:11:31,620
All of companies aren't like that.

207
00:11:31,620 --> 00:11:33,860
Microsoft, Cisco, CompTIA.

208
00:11:33,860 --> 00:11:36,880
They don't care who you take the course
from or what course you use, or

209
00:11:36,880 --> 00:11:40,420
whether you studied from a book, whether
you have hands on, they don't care.

210
00:11:40,420 --> 00:11:42,920
Just as long as you go in and
pass that exam, right.

211
00:11:42,920 --> 00:11:45,863
But VMware wants to ensure that everyone
gets the same level of training and

212
00:11:45,863 --> 00:11:46,430
excellence.

213
00:11:46,430 --> 00:11:48,868
And they do that by very,
very tightly controlling it.

214
00:11:48,868 --> 00:11:50,940
So that's why they do it.

215
00:11:52,180 --> 00:11:54,280
All right, but
if you've taken any of those courses,

216
00:11:54,280 --> 00:11:56,580
then you can request authorization,
you'll get it.

217
00:11:56,580 --> 00:11:58,840
You go and take the exam, you pass it, and

218
00:11:58,840 --> 00:12:02,319
you're now a VMware Certified Professional
for Data Center Virtualization.

219
00:12:04,022 --> 00:12:04,560
All right, so for

220
00:12:04,560 --> 00:12:07,780
our show, we're gonna be running through
all the content that's on the exam.

221
00:12:07,780 --> 00:12:09,507
And if we take a look
at that exam blueprint,

222
00:12:09,507 --> 00:12:12,605
it runs through some of the major areas
that a lot of us are gonna have to tackle.

223
00:12:12,605 --> 00:12:16,987
Basically, we start out with simple things
like just getting the thing installed,

224
00:12:16,987 --> 00:12:18,477
that's kind of important.

225
00:12:18,477 --> 00:12:23,706
So we're gonna see getting the V Center
installed, and getting VMware,

226
00:12:23,706 --> 00:12:29,880
vSphere, the Hypervisor ESX, getting it
installed, and our basic configuration.

227
00:12:29,880 --> 00:12:33,000
That's really what
objective one is all about.

228
00:12:33,000 --> 00:12:36,360
From there it moves into Objective two,
which is the networking side.

229
00:12:36,360 --> 00:12:40,260
It used to be that virtualization
networking was a really simple thing, but

230
00:12:40,260 --> 00:12:43,440
VMware has released some really,
really cool stuff,

231
00:12:43,440 --> 00:12:48,620
like distributed virtual switches, which
are awesome, which makes them complex.

232
00:12:48,620 --> 00:12:51,440
And so in Objective two,
we take a look at how we plan and

233
00:12:51,440 --> 00:12:55,229
configure the networking
piece inside of vSphere.

234
00:12:56,810 --> 00:13:00,080
Then in section three,
we start to take a look at storage.

235
00:13:00,080 --> 00:13:02,990
VMware supports a lot of different
types of storages, local storage,

236
00:13:02,990 --> 00:13:04,360
direct attached storage.

237
00:13:04,360 --> 00:13:07,980
There's fiber channel SANs,
there's iSCSI storage,

238
00:13:07,980 --> 00:13:11,410
there's remote fiber channel SANs,
all sorts of different things.

239
00:13:11,410 --> 00:13:14,670
And so we'll take a look at what's
involved, and getting those set up,

240
00:13:14,670 --> 00:13:18,219
and how they work, and how we can use
them to store our virtual machines.

241
00:13:19,680 --> 00:13:21,240
Then we get into section four.

242
00:13:21,240 --> 00:13:23,990
It's how we deal with
the virtual machines themselves.

243
00:13:23,990 --> 00:13:26,600
The first three sections are really just
about setting up your infrastructure.

244
00:13:26,600 --> 00:13:28,640
We haven't even created
a virtual machine yet.

245
00:13:28,640 --> 00:13:31,500
So in section four,
we take a look at those VMs.

246
00:13:31,500 --> 00:13:33,080
When we create virtual machines,

247
00:13:33,080 --> 00:13:37,120
the guest operating systems that are
running on our virtualization platform.

248
00:13:37,120 --> 00:13:40,100
And we also talked a little bit
about V apps, virtual apps, and

249
00:13:40,100 --> 00:13:43,370
this is where the applications
themselves can be tracked, managed,

250
00:13:43,370 --> 00:13:45,340
and failed over inside of VMware.

251
00:13:45,340 --> 00:13:49,660
So we get a chance to see a lot of that.

252
00:13:49,660 --> 00:13:53,400
All right, once we get past that,
you've got section five,

253
00:13:53,400 --> 00:13:55,980
which is Establishing and
Maintaining Service Levels.

254
00:13:55,980 --> 00:13:59,820
When you've got everything set up,
how do you keep it up and running?

255
00:13:59,820 --> 00:14:04,670
We need to keep it running healthy, and we
need to spot problems before they occur,

256
00:14:04,670 --> 00:14:05,920
and that's what this section is about.

257
00:14:05,920 --> 00:14:10,050
We take a look at VMware clusters for
doing failover and high availability, and

258
00:14:10,050 --> 00:14:14,580
a few other neat little tools that we have
inside of VMware to provide that reliable

259
00:14:14,580 --> 00:14:17,900
infrastructure that we need, because
we depend on these platforms more and

260
00:14:17,900 --> 00:14:18,920
more as time goes on.

261
00:14:20,220 --> 00:14:22,570
And then is section six,
we've got our troubleshooting.

262
00:14:22,570 --> 00:14:25,360
Sometimes things don't work the way
that we expect them to, and so

263
00:14:25,360 --> 00:14:27,070
we've gotta go and find out why.

264
00:14:27,070 --> 00:14:28,170
Section six tackles that.

265
00:14:28,170 --> 00:14:33,420
We just go and look for the issues, run a
standardized troubleshooting methodology,

266
00:14:33,420 --> 00:14:35,880
find the problem, fix it, and
get ourselves back and running.

267
00:14:35,880 --> 00:14:39,780
You know, step one is just to get
your services back to operational.

268
00:14:39,780 --> 00:14:42,510
Step two is to fix the problem and
get your system back to 100%.

269
00:14:42,510 --> 00:14:45,440
So we run through that process and
get a chance to see it.

270
00:14:47,282 --> 00:14:51,080
All right, section seven is just
monitoring the implementation.

271
00:14:51,080 --> 00:14:54,450
So once it's up and running,
how do we keep an eye on performance and

272
00:14:54,450 --> 00:14:55,030
other things?

273
00:14:55,030 --> 00:14:58,020
So that's what we talk about here,
monitoring the big four, disk,

274
00:14:58,020 --> 00:15:02,800
memory, network, and CPU,
monitoring that utilization, and

275
00:15:02,800 --> 00:15:05,420
making sure that our hardware
is not being over subscribed.

276
00:15:05,420 --> 00:15:08,650
We don't wanna overtax our hardware,
it'll result in poor performance.

277
00:15:11,180 --> 00:15:13,810
So those are the main
objectives right there, and

278
00:15:13,810 --> 00:15:17,130
then after you've learned all that
information you're ready to go and

279
00:15:17,130 --> 00:15:21,022
take that VCP5 exam,
the VCP550 is what we're gonna cover.

280
00:15:21,022 --> 00:15:24,990
All right, let's see,
what else do I have to mention here?

281
00:15:24,990 --> 00:15:27,040
I mentioned the re-cert,
which is important.

282
00:15:27,040 --> 00:15:30,160
Every two years you've
got to repeat the exam.

283
00:15:30,160 --> 00:15:34,840
If you attempt the exam and you do not
pass, there is a seven day waiting period.

284
00:15:34,840 --> 00:15:37,680
You have to wait a week before
you can take the exam again.

285
00:15:37,680 --> 00:15:42,340
Not too bad, but they do make you pause,
not just jump right back in.

286
00:15:42,340 --> 00:15:46,820
And the reason they do that is not
to be annoying, but because you can,

287
00:15:46,820 --> 00:15:50,230
even unintentionally,
you can memorize questions on the exam.

288
00:15:50,230 --> 00:15:53,325
So if you go right back in and take it
the next day, a lot of those questions

289
00:15:53,325 --> 00:15:56,865
are fresh in your mind and
you can move a lot faster because of it.

290
00:15:56,865 --> 00:15:58,545
So they make you wait a week,

291
00:15:58,545 --> 00:16:02,889
just to ensure that short-term
memory isn't kicking in there, and

292
00:16:02,889 --> 00:16:05,355
it kinda takes that advantage away
that you might get from that.

293
00:16:07,600 --> 00:16:09,150
But that's basically it.

294
00:16:09,150 --> 00:16:13,769
The VCP, the VMware Certified
Professional, especially the VCP5-DCV,

295
00:16:13,769 --> 00:16:15,410
very good certification.

296
00:16:15,410 --> 00:16:17,340
It all looks great on your resume.

297
00:16:17,340 --> 00:16:19,650
Does show that you really know VMware.

298
00:16:19,650 --> 00:16:22,330
How it works and how to support
it in an enterprise environment.

299
00:16:22,330 --> 00:16:23,940
And it's a very good skill to have.

300
00:16:23,940 --> 00:16:29,430
So, whether you plan to take the exam or
not, it's still great knowledge to have.

301
00:16:29,430 --> 00:16:31,310
So I encourage you guys
to sit through the show.

302
00:16:31,310 --> 00:16:34,010
We're gonna cover some
really good stuff there.

303
00:16:34,010 --> 00:16:35,825
It is very common in the real world.

304
00:16:35,825 --> 00:16:40,755
Hyper-V is nice, XenServer is nice,
but VMware, it's the top dog.

305
00:16:40,755 --> 00:16:42,541
It's the market leader in this area,
and so

306
00:16:42,541 --> 00:16:44,777
you definitely wanna have
that skill in your toolkit.

307
00:16:44,777 --> 00:16:46,971
All right, so that's about it.

308
00:16:46,971 --> 00:16:49,227
I hope to see you guys in the show.

309
00:16:49,227 --> 00:16:55,869
[MUSIC]

topics.title: Overview of VMware Certified Professional VCP5-DCV

episodes.description: In this episode Don introduces the viewers to the VMware vShpere suite. He discusses the multiple editions of vSphere and walks through the process of setting up your first vCenter server.
episodes.title: Intro and Installing vCenter

episodes.description: In this episode Don demonstrate installing and configuring the VMware ESXi hypervisor. He discusses some of the hardware requirements and walks through the installation procedure.
episodes.title: Installing ESXi

episodes.description: In this episode Don examines the process of updating vCenter and ESXi and some of the pitfalls that may arise. He also examines securing your ESXi installation to prevent unintended vulnerabilities.
episodes.title: Updating and Securing ESXi

topics.title: Plan, Install, Configure and Upgrade vCenter Server and VMware ESXi

episodes.description: In this episode Don introduces the viewers to VMware vSwitches. He shows how to configure management interfaces as well as storage interfaces for an ESXi host. He also demonstrates configuring distributed virtual switches and shows some of the advantages of the advanced configuration.
episodes.title: Configuring Networking

episodes.description: In this episode Don takes a look at configuring data stores in vSphere. He demonstrates using local and shared data stores to hold virtual machines as well as installation images.
episodes.title: Configuring Storage

episodes.description: In this episode Don walks the viewer through creating a virtual machine and examines the various configuration options available inside of ESXi.
episodes.title: Creating Virtual Machines

episodes.description: In this episode Don demonstrates how to use vApps to group and manage multiple virtual machines in support of a disturbed application. He also takes a look at how to clone a virtual machine and build templates for rapid deployment.
episodes.title: Creating Virtual Machines Part 2

topics.title: Deploy and Administer Virtual Machines and vApps

episodes.description: In this episode Don introduces the viewer to cluster technologies inside of VMware. He discusses the various methods of ensuring virtual machines remain online in the event of a failure. He then demonstrates vMotion and the VMware vSphere Distributed Resource Scheduler.
episodes.title: vSphere Clustering

episodes.description: In this episode Don continues exploring the high availability features inside VMware vSphere. He demonstrates how to configure vSphere HA and Fault Tolerance (FT) in a vSphere datacenter.
episodes.title: vSphere Clustering Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Don wraps up the series on vSphere clustering. He demonstrates using VDP to backup virtual machines and using vSphere replication to copy virtual machines to another location.
episodes.title: vSphere Clustering Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Don runs through the general techniques used to troubleshoot a VMware vSphere deployment. He breaks down the various tools that can be used to troubleshoot specific areas such as networking and performance.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting

episodes.description: In this episode Don builds upon the troubleshooting techniques by demonstrating how to properly monitor a vSphere deployment to detect problems before they occur. He begins the show using tools found within the vSphere suite as ends the show demonstrating VMwareâ€™s vCenter Operations Manager.
episodes.title: Monitoring
